title: 'Mountain of grief': Sunetra breaks silence after Ajit Pawar's death
content: Sunetra Pawar took oath as Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, vowing to carry forward her late husband Ajit Pawar's legacy. She expressed being "overwhelmed with emotions" while accepting the responsibility, emphasizing her commitment to working tirelessly for the state's development and its people.

title: Explosion rocks Iranâ€™s Bandar Abbas port; building, shops damaged
content: A powerful explosion ripped through an eight-storey building in Iran's Bandar Abbas port city, causing significant damage to its structure, vehicles, and shops. While the cause remains under investigation, authorities have dismissed claims of a targeted attack. The incident occurs amidst escalating regional tensions and ongoing domestic unrest.

title: Sunetra Pawar is new Maha dy CM: Wives who inherited husbands' political legacy
content: Sunetra Pawar has been sworn in as Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister, succeeding her late husband Ajit Pawar. Elected NCP legislature party leader, she will assume his portfolios, excluding finance. This move echoes historical instances of women stepping into politics to uphold family legacies after their husbands' passing.

title: Ex-Google engineer convicted of stealing AI secrets for China startup
content: Former Google engineer Linwei Ding was convicted of economic espionage and theft of trade secrets for stealing thousands of pages of confidential AI technology information.  Ding intended to benefit the People's Republic of China by using Google's proprietary data to develop AI supercomputers and machine learning chips, putting U.S. technological leadership at risk.

title: Economic Survey: Degrees are rising, job certainty isnâ€™t; tomorrowâ€™s Budget gets tested here
content: The Economic Survey 2025â€“26 reads like a map of where Indian education quietly loses peopleâ€”after Class 8, at the school-to-work handover, and in the steady outward rush of students seeking predictability. On Budget eve, the question isnâ€™t another scheme. Itâ€™s whether spending will strengthen the weak jointsâ€”so families donâ€™t have to keep paying privately for certainty.

title: 'Give me Zimbabwe or I'll retire': Babar Azam falls for 2; triggers criticism
content: Babar Azam's struggles continued in the T20I series against Australia, as he was dismissed for just 2 runs by Adam Zampa in the second match. This low score has sparked debate on social media, with some questioning his place in Pakistan's T20 squad.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.

title: 'Insult to fans': Pakistan cricket erupts; slams Australia amid T20 WC row
content: Pakistan expresses concern over visiting SENA teams resting key players, following a second-string Australia's T20I loss. Australia's decision to rest several top players for the series, citing recovery and World Cup preparation, has drawn criticism from former Pakistani cricketers and analysts who view it as an insult to their cricket.

title: Gold, silver price crash: $5 trillion lost in market cap! What led to the spectacular fall
content: Gold prices dropped by a whopping Rs 14,000 per 10 grams and silver prices tanked by Rs 20,000 per kg in Delhi on Friday. The sharp dip came after gold hit a fresh high of Rs 1,83,000 and silver of Rs 4,04,500 on Thursday.

title: Kit launch cancelled! Are Pakistan on the brink of boycotting the T20 World Cup?
content: Pakistan's participation in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 is shrouded in uncertainty despite squad announcements and scheduled departure. Rumors of a boycott persist, fueled by a cancelled kit launch and PCB's stance on security concerns, with a final decision expected soon.

title: Nvidia H-1B data reveals US pay as Jensen Huang reviews all compensation
content: Nvidia's soaring stock has created millionaires among its employees, with H-1B visa filings revealing substantial base salaries for critical roles. While CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes personal involvement in compensation, earlier hires have significantly benefited from equity appreciation. The data offers a glimpse into the pay for engineers, architects, researchers, and product managers, excluding bonuses and equity.

title: Budget 2026: No mention in Constitution, Sunday presentation & more â€” 10 facts
content: India's Union Budget, a key economic event, holds many fascinating historical details.  The Constitution calls it the 'Annual Financial Statement'.  This year's budget presentation on a Sunday is a first.  From colonial-era evening timings to the shift to February 1, traditions have evolved.  The 'bahi khata' now symbolizes Indian identity.  The railway budget is now integrated.

title: Setback for World No. 1 Sabalenka! Rybakina lifts Australian Open title
content: Elena Rybakina won the Australian Open title by defeating world number one Aryna Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4, avenging her 2023 final loss. She recovered from a 3-0 deficit in the deciding set, won five straight games, and sealed victory with an ace. The triumph marked her second Grand Slam title after Wimbledon 2022 and highlighted her mental strength and growing confidence on big stages.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026: Full card, predictions and 30th entrant tease
content: WWE's historic Royal Rumble 2026 in Riyadh features a stacked card, including AJ Styles' career-ending match against Gunther and Sami Zayn defending the Undisputed WWE Championship against Drew McIntyre. Both 30-person Royal Rumble matches are set to headline the event, with predictions favoring Liv Morgan for the women's match and Roman Reigns or Bron Breakker for the men's.

title: Epstein files: Photo shows Prince Andrew in all fours over a woman
content: Newly released US Justice Department documents reveal Prince Andrew in photographs on all fours with a woman. The files also detail Epstein's attempts to introduce a Russian woman to the Duke, discussing potential meetings and a dinner at Buckingham Palace. Andrew has consistently denied any wrongdoing related to Epstein.

title: â€˜Criticism doesnâ€™t matterâ€™: Bhaker not setting medal goals for Asian Championship
content: Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker says criticism no longer affects her as she prepares for the Asian Rifle/Pistol Championship in Delhi. The 23-year-old credits maturity, experience, and public support since her two Paris 2024 bronze medals for her positive mindset. Competing at home excites rather than pressures her. Feeling fit and focused, Bhaker has avoided medal expectations, instead setting personal performance standards.

title: 'Really looking forward': Shashi Tharoor excited for Sanju Samson's homecoming T20I
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor is excited for the final T20I between India and New Zealand. He wishes luck to Team India and local player Sanju Samson. The match is a big occasion for Thiruvananthapuram fans. It is also India's last game before the T20 World Cup. India leads the series 3-1.

title: Jhanvi Kukreja murder case: Accused Shree Jogdhankar convicted; co-accused Diya Padalkar acquitted
content: In a 2021 murder case, a Mumbai sessions court is hearing the trial of Shree Jogdhankar and Diya Padalkar for the death of 19-year-old Jhanvi Kukreja. Kukreja was found dead with 48 injuries after a New Year's Eve party. The prosecution presented circumstantial evidence, including CCTV footage and forensic reports, to establish the chain of events.

title: New details emerge as FBI links Ryan Weddingâ€™s wife and inner circle to drug killings
content: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to federal charges tied to drug trafficking and murder. US authorities say he led a billion-dollar drug ring uncovered through Operation Giant Slalom. Several alleged associates, including his wife, girlfriend, lawyer, and international partners, have been sanctioned, arrested, or face extradition, according to the FBI and US Department of Justice.

title: 'Not my day, but I gave everything': Sinner reacts after Djokovic ends Australian Open run
content: World No. 2 Jannik Sinner graciously acknowledged his Australian Open semi-final defeat to Novak Djokovic, admitting the loss hurt but commending the Serbian's performance. Despite a strong effort and recent wins against Djokovic, Sinner converted only two of 18 break points. He expressed gratitude for fan support and vowed to learn from the experience.

title: Sonam Wangchuk taken to AIIMS in Jodhpur after stomach pain complain;
content: Jailed activist Sonam Wangchuk underwent a medical examination at AIIMS Jodhpur following a Supreme Court directive.  The court is reviewing his detention under the NSA, with his wife challenging the grounds. Wangchuk, reportedly suffering from stomach ailments, has raised concerns about his health, prompting the specialist examination.

title: Denied access to funeral ground, Dalits light pyre on Bihar road
content: Dalit villagers in Bihar's Vaishali were allegedly prevented from using the local cremation ground, forcing them to cremate a 91-year-old woman on a public road. The incident, which occurred in Sondho-Vashudeo village, has sparked tensions and prompted an official inquiry into the alleged discrimination.

title: 'Ajit Dada amar rahe': Sunetra Pawar takes oath as Maharashtra deputy CM 3 days after husband's death
content: Sunetra Pawar has been sworn in as Maharashtra's deputy chief minister, stepping into the role previously held by her husband, Ajit Pawar, following his tragic passing. She will assume his responsibilities, excluding the finance portfolio. This significant political transition occurred after her unanimous election as the NCP legislative party leader.

title: Blue drum murders: A chilling pattern of spousal betrayal and brutal killings
content: A gruesome murder in Meerut, involving a body sealed in a blue drum, has sparked a wave of similar crimes across multiple states. These cases highlight patterns of domestic betrayal, third-party involvement, and extreme methods used to conceal murder, leaving investigators and the public deeply uneasy.

title: Trichy bus driver slaps passenger multiple times for asking him to avoid rash driving
content: A private bus driver in Trichy was arrested after assaulting a passenger who requested him to slow down due to rash driving. The incident, captured on video, escalated into a physical altercation at the bus stand. The driver faces charges including voluntarily causing hurt and criminal intimidation.

title: â€˜Maa, Maati, Manush unsafe in Bengalâ€™: Amit Shah targets Mamata Banerjee at BJP meet
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched a scathing attack on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, accusing her government of failing women, people, and land while fostering corruption and infiltration for votes. Shah highlighted concerns over border security, the Anandpur fire incident, and alleged intimidation of communities, urging voters to elect a BJP government for national security and development.

title: No one from my family will attend Sunetraâ€™s oath-taking ceremony: Sharad Pawar
content: Sharad Pawar expressed surprise regarding Sunetra Pawar's oath-taking ceremony, stating he was neither consulted nor informed. He confirmed no family members would attend, attributing the decision to party leaders Sunil Tatkare and Praful Patel. Pawar learned of Sunetra's selection as deputy chief minister through news reports, emphasizing it was an internal party matter.

title: Triple murder: Man kills parents, sister, buries bodies in rented house
content: A shocking triple murder has rocked Kottur, where a man, Akshay Kumar, allegedly killed his parents and sister. The victims were reportedly buried within their rented home. Akshay later filed a missing persons report in Bengaluru, attempting to mislead authorities. He confessed to the crime during police interrogation. The motive remains unclear as investigations continue.

title: Getting into a live-in while already being in one will attract up to 7 yrsâ€™ jail: Uâ€™khand UCC
content: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

title: 'Border 2' box office day 9 : Sunny Deol's war drama crosses 238 crore on 2nd Saturday
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its impressive box office run, raking in Rs 245 crore domestically and Rs 323 crore worldwide. Despite a competitive release, the war epic, a spiritual successor to the 1997 hit, is drawing crowds. The film, featuring a star-studded cast, strategically utilized the Republic Day holiday for a strong opening.

title: 22-year-old crushed to death by concrete slab while shooting reel in Bareilly
content: A 22-year-old barber, Mohd Faizan, tragically died while filming a social media reel near an under-construction flyover in Bareilly. He fell from a support wall and a concrete slab collapsed on him. Rescuers took nearly half an hour to remove the debris, by which time Faizan was pronounced dead.

title: Pat Cummins ruled out of T20 World Cup; Australia announce squad
content: Australia faces a blow as Pat Cummins is out of the T20 World Cup 2026 due to injury. Mitchell Marsh will lead the 15-member squad, with Ben Dwarshuis and Matthew Renshaw drafted in as replacements.  Selectors praised their pace, fielding, and batting versatility, anticipating their value in the tournament's conditions.

title: Foul air causing deaths? â€˜Yesâ€™, â€˜canâ€™t sayâ€™: 2 govt arms take differing stands
content: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

title: Right-wing group vows to block rebuilding of Bulleh Shah shrine
content: A right-wing group, Kali Sena, has threatened to oppose the reconstruction of Sufi poet Bulleh Shah's mazaar in Mussoorie, vowing to build a Hanuman temple instead. This follows vandalism of the mazaar and protests by Bajrang Dal activists. Congress leaders have urged police action against the threats.

title: Alzheimerâ€™s hits women harder: Can omega-3 turn the tide?
content: Women face a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease. Omega-3 fatty acids, found in fish and supplements, are crucial for brain health and may help prevent cognitive decline. This is particularly important for women in developing nations who encounter numerous challenges in accessing healthcare. Nutrition-focused interventions, alongside broader support systems, are vital for their well-being.

title: Ghaziabad stabbing: 2 killed over delay in serving food at eatery near Khoda police station; 4 detained
content: A fatal stabbing incident near Khoda police station on January 30 resulted in two deaths and one injury. Police responded to a scuffle and found three injured individuals. Two succumbed to their injuries during treatment. The third injured person is stable. An investigation is ongoing, and some individuals have been detained for questioning.

title: Indian football: ISL clubs ask for relegation to be paused for 3-5 years; request stability
content: Indian Super League (ISL) clubs have written to the Joint Secretary of the Sports Ministry and requested that relegation be scrapped for three to five seasons, considering the difficult circumstances prevailing in India's top division. The clubs have asked that the upcoming season be considered a "virtual force majeure."

title: Giants co-owner Tisch named in latest Epstein file...
content: Giants co-owner Steve Tisch's name appears at least 440 times among millions of documents in the latest release of Jeffrey Epstein files, including some that show Epstein connected him to numerous women.

title: Rybakina rallies to stop Sabalenka for Aussie titl...
content: Elena Rybakina won the Australian Open title with a 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 victory over top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka on Saturday that avenged her loss in the championship decider here in 2023.

title: Sources: Seahawks to go up for sale after SB LX
content: The Seahawks will go up for sale after Super Bowl LX, league and ownership sources familiar with the arrangement told ESPN.

title: Jokic returns from injury to net 31 in Nuggets' wi...
content: Nikola Jokic returned to the Nuggets' lineup after being sidelined since Dec. 29 with a bone bruise in his hyperextended left knee and had 31 points and 12 rebounds in a 122-109 win over the Clippers.

title: Unrivaled draws record crowd of 21,490 in Philly
content: Unrivaled co-founder Napheesa Collier said it was "unbelievable" to see a record 21,490 fans attend the 3-on-3 league's inaugural tour stop in Philadelphia.

title: Draymond: Not losing sleep as Giannis talk swirls
content: As reports swirl over a potential Giannis-to-Golden State trade, Draymond Green said he has "no reason to sit and worry" about his Warriors future but also said he understands trades are part of the business.

title: Sources: Ravens to hire Doyle, 29, to be new OC
content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

title: Wilson, A's reach agreement on 7-year extension
content: All-Star shortstop Jacob Wilson and the Athletics reached agreement on a seven-year contract that includes a club option for an eighth season, the team announced Friday.

content: Naidu pedals for green mobility as the district sets a global milestone within 24 hours. DWCRA women benefit from solar-powered transport, with the government planning dedicated cycle tracks to support sustainable commuting

content: Odisha Cabinet also approves the continuation of international flights with State viability gap funding (VGF) support.

content: Joby Mathew, Indian para-athlete and champion arm wrestler from Kerala, highlights how lack of access to public spaces impedes his daily life despite his sporting achievements

content: Left Democratic Front to stage protests on February 2 demanding transparency and accuracy in preparation of electoral roll

title: Sunetra Pawar sworn in as first woman Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra
content: Sunetra Pawar was unanimously elected as the leader of the NCP Legislature Party in Maharashtra on January 31, three days after the death of her husband and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar

content: â€œThe focus of the investigation is to determine whether the violence was the result of any organised conspiracy, the spread of fake or misleading information, or deliberate provocation to stoke communal passion,â€ says an NIA official

title: Kerala for All conclave: State government mulling industrial status for tourism sector, says Minister Rajeeve
content: Industries Minister says tourism entrepreneurs cites two main benefits for raising such a demand â€“ low power charges and provision for availing of loans with low interest rates. The Electricity department is now considering the first and the Finance department, the second.

title: Retired IAF personnel shot at in lucknow
content: Avadhesh Kumar Pathak was keeping some items from his shop in his car when two unknown individuals fired at him, with a bullet hitting him above his right eye, the police said.

title: Hearing on ED chargesheet consideration against Al Falah chairman deferred to February 13
content: The ED had, on January 16, attached â‚¹140 crore worth land and buildings of Haryana-based Al Falah University, which came under the radar of the security agencies following the November 10 Red Fort area blast

content: CPI(M) state secretary M.V. Govindan, Rajya Sabha MP A.A. Rahim and Leader of Opposition V.D. Satheesan were of the view that the reasons behind the death of Roy needs to be investigated

content: Ram Temple Construction Committee chairman said that after April 30, all agreements with L&T, Tata Consultancy and the State Construction Corporation will be taken over by the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust.

content: The drone briefly hovered over Indian territory along the International Border (IB) near Chillyari village, they said, adding that the suspicious flying object returned towards Pakistan after hovering for a couple of minutes along the IB.

content: Carrying placards seeking attention and end to the thrashing of Kashmiris outside Jammu & Kashmir, PDP leaders assembled at the party headquarters in Srinagar.

content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh decides to use an algorithm which confines itself to record-keeping and retrieval without any external influence

title: Diesel mafia hampering State revenue, say traders
content: Consumer outlets meant to supply fuel to large projects like mining and industrial units were sourcing diesel from other States even though they are mandated to source it within the State, APFPT office bearers said

content: The "Save Manipur" rally was organised by the Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity (COCOMI),  an umbrella body of several Meitei civil society organisations

content: Two students reportedly held the boy by his hands and legs and swung him, causing him to lose his balance and fall into the burning pit, the police said

title: Beijing stages â€˜combat readinessâ€™ patrols at Scarborough Shoal in disputed South China Sea
content:
China carried out fresh naval and air patrols around the disputed Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea, in a move likely to heighten tensions with the Philippines and its treaty ally, the United States. Chinaâ€™s Southern Theater Command said warships and military aircraft conducted "combat readiness" patrols around Scarborough Shoal on Saturday, framing the operation as a response to what it called "infringement provocations of individual countries within the region."

BRICS Member SNUBS Trumpâ€™s Drone Push; Indonesia Blocks US Surveillance Request Over South China

title: Waiter At Popular Kolkata Restaurant Arrested For Serving Beef To YouTuber
content: A waiter at a well-known bar-cum-restaurant on Kolkata's Park Street has been arrested after an actor and YouTuber accused the establishment of serving him beef instead of mutton.

title: Sunetra Pawar Takes Oath, Becomes Maharashtra's 1st Woman Deputy Chief Minister
content: Sunetra Pawar, the wife of Nationalist Congress Party leader Ajit Pawar, took oath as Maharashtra's first woman Deputy Chief Minister today.

title: 'To Entrap, Defame': Bill Gates On Epstein Files' Sex With Russian Girls' Claim
content: Bill Gates has responded to allegations in the Epstein files regarding him contracting sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) after sexual encounters with "Russian girls". Gates called the claims "absolutely absurd and completely false".

title: Woman Forced To Deliver Child On Roadside After Ambulance Fails To Arrive
content: A flickering torchlight. An open road in the dead of night. A tarpaulin pulled up as a makeshift curtain, and beneath it, a woman giving birth.

title: Friend Shree Jogdhankar Gets Life Imprisonment In Jhanvi Kukreja Murder Case
content: A Mumbai court on Saturday delivered its verdict in the sensational 2021 Jhanvi Kukreja murder case, sentencing her friend Shree Jogdhankar to life imprisonment, while acquitting another accused Diya Padalkar.

title: Sonam Wangchuk Taken To AIIMS After Complaining Of Stomach Pain
content: Activist and scientist Sonam Wangchuk, who has been lodged in the Jodhpur Central Jail since September 27, 2025, was taken to AIIMS Jodhpur for medical examination early Saturday morning, officials said.

title: Israel Kills 29 Palestinians In Gaza, One Of Deadliest Days Since October
content: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 29 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest deaths since the October ceasefire aimed at stopping the fighting.

title: Analysis: Behind NCP's Rushed Move To Elevate Sunetra Pawar
content: On Wednesday morning, NCP chief and Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash. Just three days later, on Saturday evening, his wife Sunetra Pawar took the oath as Deputy Chief Minister.

title: Union Budget 2026: How Indira Gandhi Nationalised 14 Banks Overnight In 1969
content: On the midnight of July 19, 1969, the government, led by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, nationalised 14 major Indian banks, each with reserves exceeding Rs 50 crore.

title: Sunetra Pawar Oath Ceremony LIVE Updates: Live Updates: Sunetra Pawar Takes Oath Amid 'Ajit Dada Amar Rahe' Chants
content: Sunetra Pawar Oath Taking Ceremony LIVE Updates: Sunetra Pawar will take oath as Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister today, at 5 pm.

title: After Baramati Crash, Concerns Over 'Uncontrolled' Airfields For VIP Flights
content: The recent plane crash in Maharashtra's Baramati that killed five including deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar has once again put the spotlight on uncontrolled airfields, and raised serious questions over whether they are fit for VIP movements at all.

title: Morarji Desai Presented Most Budgets; Where Nirmala Sitharaman Stands
content: Former Prime Minister Morarji Desai holds the record for presenting the highest number of Union Budgets. He presented 10 Budgets, and it remains a record.

title: Kerala Court Allows Termination Of 31 Weeks Old Foetus With Abnormalities
content: The Kerala High Court has come to the aid of a couple seeking medical termination of their over 31 weeks old foetus, which suffers from congenital abnormalities of the brain and head, by allowing them to go ahead with the procedure.

title: At Madhya Pradesh Police Station, A Car In Handcuffs
content: In Jabalpur's Lordganj police station, criminals aren't the only ones getting restrained these days. A parked car wearing handcuffs inside the police station premises has turned into an unlikely attraction.

title: Minor Rape Victim Dies After Consuming Pesticide In UP's Meerut
content: A 16-year-old girl allegedly consumed pesticide after being raped by a man here and died during treatment at a hospital, police said on Saturday.

title: ICE Agents Claim Man Broke Skull By Running Into Wall, Sparks Tension
content: Intensive care nurses immediately doubted the word of federal immigration officers when they arrived at a Minneapolis hospital with a Mexican immigrant who had broken bones in his face and skull.

title: "Fulfil Ajit Dada's Final Wish": NCP's Jayant Patil Calls For Factions' Merger
content: Senior leader of the Nationalist Congress Party (Sharadchandra Pawar faction), Jayant Patil, has made a major revelation about the party's efforts to merge with another faction, citing the late Ajit Pawar's insistence on unity.

title: Gunmen Loot Rs 6 Lakh From SBI ATM In Hyderabad
content: Unidentified assailants opened fire on a man and looted Rs 6 lakh from him at the State Bank of India (SBI) main branch ATM in Koti, Hyderabad, police said on Saturday.

title: US Real Estate Mogul Offers Woman $3 Million To Leave Husband. Case Follows
content: A married real estate mogul is accused of offering a female subordinate more than $3 million drawn from his company's stock as part of an "indecent proposal" to lure her away from her husband, according to a lawsuit.

title: WWE 'SmackDown': Live results and analysis
content: The go-home "SmackDown" ahead of the Royal Rumble ended in chaos, potentially a sign of things to come on Saturday at Royal Rumble. Drew McIntyre dragged Sami Zayn out of the ring during an 8-man tag main event featuring The Vision challenging Zayn, Cody Rhodes, Randy Orton and Jey Uso, which led to a DQ. Jacob Fatu joined the fun and attacked McIntyre, with& Bron Breakker closing "SmackDown" by spearing Rhodes and Zayn. Earlier in the show, Carmelo Hayes defended his United States Championship against Rey Fenix in an open challenge match, AJ Styles and Gunther traded verbal jabs on the mic, and the team of Charlotte Flair and Alexa Bliss defeated Liv Morgan and Roxanne Perez from The Judgement Day. Arda Ocal broke down all the action from "SmackDown" in Riyadh.
